page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO HAILSHAM
page.content: Hailsham is a market town, eight miles north of{Eastbourne.}It is situated in the middle of the sheep rearing area between the{South Downs {and{The Weald. The{market}is one of the town's main attractions where Cattle, Pigs and Sheep are auctioned and many household items can be bought.Another attraction is the{Common Pond}which has existed since before 1263 when there were records of an accidental drowning.It has an island in the centre and it is well looked after. Hailsham used to have a railway linking it with Polegate and Eastbourne but it was closed down in 1968. The oldest architecture in Hailsham is the{Parish {Church,}it was built in 1229. Hailsham has grown immensly, in 1961 the population was approx.{5000,}in 1981 it was{12510.
